Jackie was directed by Pablo Larraín and stars Nichole Kidman who plays Jacqueline Kennedy known as Jackie ", tells a journalist the story about her life after the 1963 assassination of her husband John F Kennedy In her interview she reminds every single thing that had been hidden and hard for her to tell with some of the moments flashbacks grieving regretting and sometimes outraged at the man Having two kids who were too little to understand the situation clearly at that time she also had to make up her mind what she's do with her fatherless kids which was intolerant for her as well This movie of course mainly focuses on her story of what she did for her lost husband and is very biographical It s like we just listen to her interview for 100m ins sitting on a chair and doing nothing but looking at the screen Although we must not call it a boring film it s only for those who are interested in that sort of history or political staff in my opinion But I never got bored thanks to such a really great Natalie s performance as Jackie There were only a few people at the c inema tho Thanks to reading my review of Jackie "!.

This movie was what I would call a typical Oscar bait movie. Natalie Portman plays Jacqueline Kennedy and this movie takes place days after the JFK assasination where. she saw her husband get murdered in front of her The movie deals with Jacqueline s trauma as well as the proceeding of John F Kenn ed y's funeral and where Jacqueline stands as a public figure now that her husband President is no longer. Natalie Portman s potrayl of Jacqueline was what really carried this movie along. The conflicts that her character had to go through both internally and externally was perhaps the most intersting aspect of this movie When the movie shys away from her story and decides to focus on the political situations that occured during that time the movie really lost its momentum. The pacing is slow which is to be expected from a period piece drama but there were scenes that didn t seem like it contributed to Jacqueline s perspective on the ex periences that she had to go through. I really felt the horror and confusion going on within her once it happened and perhaps this movie can shut up all the JFK conspirators out there. I really thought Natalie Portman deserved her Oscar nomination but in the end I thought this was pretty forgettable in spite of the ambition.
